title: Towards Holistic Evaluation of Large Audio-Language Models: A Comprehensive Survey
author: Chih-Kai Yang (National Taiwan University), Neo S. Ho (National Taiwan University), Hung-yi Lee (National Taiwan University), ...
relevance_why: The paper provides a comprehensive survey and taxonomy for evaluating large audio-language models (LALMs), which can directly inform Haohe Liu's work on audio and speech processing by offering insights into benchmarking methods, gaps in the literature, and promising future directions.
background: The paper reviews various evaluation frameworks for large audio-language models, categorizing them into four dimensions to enhance systematic assessment.
contribution: This survey introduces a structured taxonomy of LALM evaluations to solve the scatter of existing benchmarks, achieving a clearer overview for researchers.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous surveys largely focused on technical specifications like model architectures but overlooked comprehensive evaluation methodologies.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work presents an organized classification of benchmarks across diverse tasks, filling a critical gap in the current literature.

key_innovation: It systematically categorizes evaluations of LALMs based on objectives such as auditory awareness, reasoning, dialogue, and safety considerations.
real_world_impact: This survey is poised to enhance the development of more robust evaluation frameworks for LALMs, significantly impacting the fields of human-computer interaction and automated audio analysis.
limitations: The taxonomy is based solely on existing benchmarks and may not encompass all potential task settings.

new_terms.large audio-language models: **Large audio-language models (LALMs)** are multimodal models that integrate audio processing capabilities with language understanding, aimed at tasks involving speech and sound.

open_sourcing: The authors plan to actively maintain and release a collection of the surveyed papers to support ongoing advancements in the field.
